TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the applicant brought an action against a private party to recover a debt under a loan contract .
On DATE the ORG of GPE awarded ORG to the applicant , with interest to be charged until DATE of actual payment .
On DATE the judgment entered into force .
On DATE the enforcement proceedings were opened . The defendant 's flat was subject to a charging order .
On DATE the bailiff seized the defendant 's car and lifted the charging order on the flat .
On DATE the bailiff suspended the enforcement proceedings until CARDINAL DATE due to the defendant 's husband 's request to separate his property from that of his wife to preserve his share .

Following the lifting of the charging order the applicant learned that the defendant had sold the flat and bought another one . The applicant alleges that the defendant sold the flat at the price RUR CARDINAL and paid ORG CARDINAL for the new one .
The applicant brought CARDINAL sets of proceedings against the bailiff . Firstly , she challenged the lifting of the charging order . Secondly , she challenged the delay in enforcement .
On DATE the ORG of GPE declared the lifting of the charging order unlawful . The court held , in particular , that “ it reduced the effectiveness of the court 's judgment ” . The bailiff appealed .
On DATE the ORG of GPE declared unlawful the suspension of DATE and the delay in enforcement of the judgment .

On DATE the ORG acting on appeal upheld the decision of DATE . The court dismissed the bailiff 's objection that the flat could not be subject to an injunction for being the defendant 's only dwelling , as having no basis in law . It found that the bailiff 's unlawful act allowed the defendant to dispose of the flat , which impeded the enforcement proceedings .
On DATE the ORG of GPE defined the property shares between the defendant and her husband .

The applicant brought an action against ORG of GPE ( ORG финансов ORG ) and ORG of ORG ( Управление юстиции администрации PERSON области ) . She claimed damages resulting from the bailiff 's failure to enforce her award . She sought a total sum of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL , representing the principal debt and the outstanding interest .

On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed her claim . It stated that “ neither the fact that the lifting of the charging order had been declared unlawful nor the undue delay of enforcement proceedings , although they resulted in a failure to execute the judgment , justifies an action for damages against the [ authorities ] because it was the [ debtor under the loan ] who had caused the damage to the applicant and who was liable pursuant to the judgment . ” The court found “ neither a fault on the part of the bailiff , nor a causal link between the bailiff 's act and the damage caused ” .

On DATE the ORG acting on appeal upheld the judgment of DATE . The court noted that the enforcement proceedings had continued and that on DATE and CARDINAL DATE the bailiff had issued injunctions in respect of a flat and a vehicle , in both of which the defendant had had a share .
On DATE the defendant 's car was seized , and in DATE it was sold . So far RUR CARDINAL has been paid to the applicant .
The LAW of GPE , adopted by referendum on DATE , provides , in so far as relevant , as follows :
“ ... CARDINAL . Decisions and actions or lack of action of state bodies , bodies of local self - government , public associations and officials may be appealed against in court . ”
“ Every person shall have the right to be reimbursed by the state for the damage caused as a result of unlawful actions ( inaction ) of the state bodies and their officials . ”
LAW of GPE , in force as of DATE , provides for compensation for damage caused by the act ( or a failure to act ) on behalf of the ORG :

“ Damage caused to an individual or a legal person as a result of an act or a failure to act by the state or municipal bodies , or their officials , including that caused by a written act issued by a state or a municipal body contrary to a law or a legislative act , shall be reimbursed . The damage shall be reimbursed by the treasury of GPE , the treasury of the subjects of GPE or the municipal treasury respectively . ”
Article CARDINAL of LAW authorises the relevant financial bodies to act on behalf of the respective treasury liable to pay damages .
LAW , in force as of DATE , provides that the damage caused by the bailiff shall be reimbursed in accordance with the civil legislation .

Article CARDINAL of LAW , in force as of DATE , provides that a dwelling can not be subject to a charging order for the purpose of enforcement , if it provides the only eligible residence for the debtor and his family .
No similar provision was in force before the entry into force of this LAW .
